info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
info.description:
At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gaines to near Perry to near Capital Region International Airport. Movement was northeast at 35 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fenton, Perry, Linden, Morrice, Byron, Bancroft, Gaines, and Lake Fenton around 730 PM EDT. Durand and Laingsburg around 735 PM EDT. Flint and Grand Blanc around 740 PM EDT. Burton and Swartz Creek around 745 PM EDT. Goodrich around 750 PM EDT. Owosso and Corunna around 755 PM EDT. Davison and Lennon around 800 PM EDT. Flushing around 815 PM EDT.
Other locations impacted by these storms include Atlas, Juddville, Rankin, Bennington, Argentine, Shaftsburg, Genesee, and Vernon.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern Michigan.
